fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When description is defined for priorities and translated to English US as per the below screenshot, other users when having their default profile language set to English US, sees the same description Users when having their default profile language set to English UK, sees the description different. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Translated the priority descriptions to English US. 
When default language is in English US, works as expected. 
Changed default language to English UK 
Priority description shows different comments. 

h3. Expected Results
Priority description should show as it is set in the description. 

h3. Actual Results

Descriptions are not showing as how it is set.  

h3. Workaround
Create new priorities and set the descriptions as this issue only persist with the default priorities. 

This has been observed for Issue types as well.
fields.summary: Translations for priorities, statuses and Issue types are not working

fields.description:
h3. JAC/Support ticket

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8839
 [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-546638]
h3. Issue Summary

Setting the language for a Jira Service Desk project to Spanish results in malformed translations.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a project's language to Spanish
 # Check *Customer notifications*

h3. Expected Results

The translations should have the correct characters.
h3. Actual Results

The translations do not have the correct characters.
For example:
{noformat}
${event.user.name} te ha aï¿½adido como participante.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually update the notifications in the *Customer notifications* section of the project by clicking on *Edit* and then clicking *Save* after updating the notification.
fields.summary: JSD: Malformed Spanish translations

fields.summary: Comments translated as 'komkmentit', should be 'kommentit'

fields.description:
Piece of feedback received in JSW next-gen in-product feedback collector.

"Tehtävälistan kommenttiosiossa lukee "Komkmentit", pitäisi olla "kommentit". Tässä kommenttiosiossa on yhtenä valittavana palauteaiheena "katso ja tunne", mikä on ilmeisesti konekäännetty englannin "look and feel" -termistä. Oikea käännös olisi "ulkoasu ja käyttötuntuma" tms."

 

English (Google translate): "The comment section of the to-do list says "Komkmentit (Comments), should be "kommentit" (comments). This comment section contains one of the feedback topics to choose from, "katso ja tunne," which is apparently machine translated from the English term "look and feel". The correct translation would be "ulkoasu ja käyttötuntuma" and so on."

 

Feedback ticket: [https://jira-feedback.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-15725?utm_medium=referral-external&utm_source=jira-sheets&utm_term=]
fields.summary: Finnish translation errors in JSW next-gen

fields.description: User profile in Servicedesk with having the German language the request change Messages come like this: Ihr Anfragestatus wurde zu \{0} geändert For internal review 20.01.2020 13:34 The same message is displayed in English profile like this: Your request status changed to For internal review 20.01.2020 13:34 Basically request message in the german language is incorrect, it should be like: Ihr Anfragestatus wurde zu For internal review geändert   Additionally when we open the properties file(translation-single-i18n_de_DE.properties)  on local instance  we can see only the below setting. sd.request.details.activity.status.update.text=Der Anfragestatus wurde zu \{0} ge\u00e4ndert.
fields.summary: German string concatenation issues creates incorrect translation

fields.description:
Hi,

This is related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/I18N-3014 

Basically we have i18n strings for confluence blueprints but they are not being rendered.

In this case the blueprints are only partially i18n-ed (the bug above the blueprints are completely i18n-ed), there are some hardcoded english strings in here.

In the monolith code repo ([https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/browse]), the i18n file is :  com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18N.properties

The translated i18n files seem to be in :
com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18N_<locale>.properties
com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18NSmartling_<locale>.properties

Here are the blueprints and the available i18n strings

 
||Blueprint||i18n strings||

fields.summary: Are Confluence Blueprints i18n strings getting translated/rendered properly

fields.description:
Reported in-
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8827
 Support ticket - [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-545289]

Following options have encoding issue by default:

- Public comment added
 - Public comment edited
 - Request reopened
 - Participant added
 - Organization Added
 - Approval required
fields.summary: Czech Language Support Has Encoding Issues

fields.description:
Hi,

Some of Confluence Clouds Blueprints are fully i18n supported.
 In some cases I can see the translated i18n strings in the monolith code repo. 
 However on creating a page in a spanish only instance, the english i18n strings are being used even though the spanish i18n strings are available.

In the monolith code repo ([https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/browse]), the i18n file is :  com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18N.properties

The translated i18n files seem to be in :
 com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18N_<locale>.properties
 com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18NSmartling_<locale>.properties

Here are all the blueprints that are i18n supported and their i18n strings:
||Blueprint||i18n strings||

h3. Summary
The button text in Task Report template is untranslated.

h3. Environment
Confirmed in Confluence 7.2.0 

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Set user profile Japanese
# Click "Create from template" button on the top bar
# Click "次へ(Next)" in the dialog
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-28 at 10.57.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
Translated text "次へ" is shown.

h3. Actual Result
The next dialog screen shows "Next" instead of "次へ"
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-28 at 10.58.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
I confirmed that Chinese and French are also untranslated. Apparently this affects all languages.

fields.description:
Hi,

We have a warning/error messages on Confluence, from when a user is redirected from www.atlassian.com to confluence. We provided the i18n strings back in Oct/Nov, however they are not translated to other languages. What do we need to do to get the strings translated?

Code Repo: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/browse
i18n files location: 
confluence-plugins/confluence-bundled-plugins/confluence-create-content-plugin/plugin/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/createcontent/i18n.properties
confluence-core/confluence/src/etc/java/com/atlassian/confluence/core/PluginsGeneratedI18N.properties

i18n strings to be translated:
# WAC redirect error messages
create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.error.all.purpose.title=Something went wrong
create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.error.all.purpose.body=We can not present you with the right template. Choose one of the available templates, or go back to www.atlassian.com and try again.
create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.error.disable.blueprint.title=The template is not available
create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.error.disable.blueprint.body=Your Confluence admin has disabled this template.  Contact your admin to make it available.

# WAC redirect warning messages
create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.warning.no.personal.space.title=No personal space available
create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.warning.no.personal.space.body=Since you do not have a personal space, select a space before creating the template.

create.content.plugin.wac.redirect.warning.old.editor.template.body=Your Confluence site is not ready to use the version of this template, which was created using the new editor.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a spelling mistake in the Norwegian version of onboarding to Confluence, when you open the link the first time you are asked to put in emails of other colleagues, and then you are asked "choose a space to work in" - in Norwegian this should be "Velg et område å jobbe i" - instead it now says "Velg et ormåde å jobbe inn" (see picture).

This is the universal onboarding to Confluence in Norwegian.
 [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/CA-89540|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/CA-895404]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # unk
 # unk

h3. Expected Results

Velg et område å jobbe i
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Velg et ormåde å jobbe inn
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Spelling mistake in Norwegian version of Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a project scrum board, after searching for filters and if we don't get the desired results, we have an option to clear all filters. In German, there is a typo for "Clear all filters"

In German the wording for "Clear all filters" is currently "Alle Filter zurücksetzten", but the correct wording would be "Alle Filter zurücksetzen" (Please refer attached Screenshot)

Affected Version: 8.5.1 Jira Software

!clear all filters in german.png|width=215,height=132!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Language should be German
 # Navigate to Boards > Any sample board
 # Search for any filters in the search box next to Quick filters
 # The current wording of "Clear all filters" is "Alle Filter zurücksetzten" 
 # It needs to be changed to correct wording to "Alle Filter zurücksetzen"

h3. Expected Results

In German, the correct wording for "Clear all filters" should be "Alle Filter zurücksetzen" 
h3. Actual Results

In German, the wording for "Clear all filters" is currently "Alle Filter zurücksetzten"
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: German Translation for "Clear all filters"

h3. Issue Summary
Incorrect translation of "Pending" on Jira Service Desk workflow transition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change profile language to "Nederlands" (Dutch).

The transition in Dutch:
 !pending_transition_dutch.png|thumbnail! 


The transition in English:
 !pending_transition_english.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The translation should be of the word "Pending", not "In progress".

h3. Actual Results
The current translation "In behandeling" means "In progress".

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Currently, in the fabric editor(new editor) in Confluence, the slash commands are localized. i.e. Japanese users will type "/コード" rather than "/code" to insert a code snippet. "/code" doesn't work. I have several concerns with this.
# the text to type after the slash will vary depending on the l10n situation. For example, currently "/expand" is not localized yet, so users will have to use English to insert this one
# I THINK slash commands are more popular w/o localized. For example, it is not localized in Slack.

Do you know whether the current situation is an expected one?

As an FYI, our slash commands include both formatting options and macros. Macros are mostly translated, so in my opinion, even if we decide to not localize the slash formatting options, slash macro options should be kept localized.
fields.summary: Localization of slash commands

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Bulk editing the due date in using a different language than English will return an error. And the error message is empty:
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Use another language than English (French or Spanish, for example)
 # Bulk edit *Due Date* to June 14th

h2. Expected Result

The Due date get edited to June 14th
h2. Current Result

JIRA returns empty error message as shown in the image above.
h2. Workaround

Use a different language or change the Date/Time format to display months in number. For example, 14th June 2018 is shown as 14/6/2018
 * 
{code:java}
Advanced Setting:
jira.date.picker.java.format: dd/MM/yy
jira.date.picker.javascript.format: %d/%m/%y
jira.date.time.picker.java.format: dd/MM/yy h:mm a
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format: %d/%m/%y %I:%M %p
{code}

 * 
{code:java}
Jira Look and Feel settings:
Time Format:  h:mm a
Day Format:  EEEE h:mm a
Complete Date/Time Format: dd/MM/yy h:mm a
Day/Month/Year Format: dd/MM/yy{code}
fields.summary: Can't bulk edit due date using different languages than English

Hi team, could you please take a look at this community question and review the current translation?
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Aboat-Translation/qaq-p/1224546

{quote}
 I think the translation problem is serious.

The priority Japanese translation is now as follows.

 

Blocker ⇒ブロッカー
Critical ⇒重要
Major⇒ 重度
Minor⇒軽度
Trivial ⇒ 最低

It 's pretty funny ...

重要　and 重度　have the same meaning,

and the 最低 is sometimes used as a bad word、like nasty.

 

Actually,

it 's not so easy to understand,

so we 're making different priorities .

 

But It's default ,

so this is a feature that I really want to improve

and ,maybe below is better I think...

 

Blocker ⇒ブロッカー　
Critical ⇒クリティカル （or 緊急）
Major ⇒ 重要（or 高）
Minor⇒中度 (or 中)
Trivial ⇒ 軽度（or 低）
{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When selecting the *Other Macros* window in Confluence, JIRA related macros may show in another language other than the default.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence with a linked JIRA instance
 * Default language is the same on both JIRA and Confluence, but a few users have another language set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Clean instance with JIRA/Confluence with both default languages set to English (UK) or English (US)
 # Create 2 users, one with English as default language, and another with a secondary language.
 # While logged in as English user, attempt to insert macro using the insert menu, but select *Other Macros* and view JIRA macros. Ensure the language matches the current default, but it may match the default of the secondary language user(s)
 # Steps to replicate summarized from -JRA-28392- and [CONFCLOUD-53760|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53760]

h3. Expected Results

Macro menu language should match that of the default language.
h3. Actual Results

Language used to describe the JIRA macros in the *Select Macro* window matches secondary language.
 !macro_display_in_spanish.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

* Possibly related to -JRA-28392- and -JRA-37916-
* This also happens on Data Center version of Confluence and JIRA, where in this case one random node will be affected in random time. Users accessing to the specific node will see JIRA gadget in non-English description while accessing to other unaffected nodes will see English description.


h3. Solution / Workaround
* Flush *Gadgets Macro Metadata* cache on the affected node and the JIRA gadget language will return to English. But this is not a permanent solution as the issue might happen again.
fields.summary: Select Macro menu displays JIRA gadget summaries in another language

fields.description:
h5. Bug Summary: 
Broken characters French translation pack when using "Invitation to email", option and after generating support.zip 
h5. Environment:
Confluence 6.7.0 (Linux 64bit), postgreSQL 9.5, configured  mailing server 
h5. Steps to replicate
Problem 1) User Invitation

* Open any Confluence page
* Click on "Share" icon. Add any existing user name/user email. Click on Share. 
Problem2) Support.zip generation:

* Change global/profile language settings to French
* Go to Confluence Administration  -> support tools (Résolution de problèmes et outils d'assistance) -> Créer ZIP d'assistance
Click on Créer.

h5. Expected results
Problem 1) 
* When sending invite notification to the user, information message is translated to French
* Email invitation is translated to French
Problem 2) 
* Message information about support.zip generation should be translated to French 

h5. Actual results
Problem1)
* When sending invite notification to the user:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-19 at 14.33.34.png|thumbnail! 
* Email invitation header is translated to:
 !email_header.png|thumbnail! 


Problem 2) 
* Message information about support.zip generation:
*  !Capture zip.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Workarounds
h6. Importing the French Language .jar file from Confluence version 6.14.x
(!) This change is unsupported and it is unclear the full extent to which the language file from a newer version could affect the instance
# Download and expand zipped copy (not an installer) of 6.14.x from our [Confluence Download Archive|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives]
# Expand the installer and copy the {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-xxxxxxxxxxx.jar}} file
#* This will vary depending on your Confluence version
# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/590259974/590058056/1/1398739558493/Cog.png! > General Configurations > Manage Add-ons
# Select Upload Add-ons
# Upload this jar file: 

h4. Updating  Language File
Per our [Confluence Server Developer: Updating a Confluence Translation|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/updating-a-confluence-translation/]
# Go to {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/}}
# Find the {{confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-xxxxxxxxxxx.jar}} file
#* This will vary depending on your Confluence version
# Extract the .jar file - this is similar to unzipping a file
# Then locate and open the following file in a text editor:
{code}
<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-xxxxxxxxxxx/com/atlassian/confluence/core/ConfluenceActionSupport_fr_FR.properties
{code}
# In Confluence browse to the following URL: <base URL>/?i18ntranslate=on
#* This set Confluence to show the [User Interface Key Names for Translation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf64/installing-a-language-pack-936511653.html]. In short, it shows the names of the corresponding elements in the language file
# Locate your desired element by browsing Confluence normally, for example if the element in Confluence for the deleted page was:
{code}
alternatives.page.intrash.title
{code}
# Find the line in the *ConfluenceActionSupport_fr_FR.properties* file, and copy and paste that information into this website on the *ASCII* side: https://native2ascii.net/
#* You can see this translation is the incorrect:
 !native_vs_ascii_wrong_translation.png|thumbnail! 
# You can then update the text to the correct language on the *Native* side:
 !native_vs_ascii_correct_translation.png|thumbnail! 
# Then copy and paste the result from the *ASCII* side and replace that line in our *ConfluenceActionSupport_fr_FR.properties* file
# You can repeat this process as desired for any problem areas
# Save the file
# Remove the existing {{confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-xxxxxxxxxxx.jar}} file
# Rezip the {{confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-xxxxxxxxxxx.jar}} directory
#* (!) Ensure the contents of the directory are not nested under a new folder within the .zip file
# Change the extension of the .zip file to .jar
# Restart Confluence and the changes will appear
fields.summary: Broken characters French translation pack

From Confluence version 6.11 to the current version

The macro names are translated correctly as in 6.10
h3. Actual result
They are in English

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

You can add an older version of the file (pre 6.11) from a previous language pack to the current language pack and then re-upload.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37718].
  {panel}

Despite being in the translation packs, some strings are not being translated. This affects all bundled languages - French, German, Spanish and Japaneses. It likely affects non-bundled language packs as well.

Affected areas discovered so far include:
* Meeting Notes Blueprint
* Watch in pages
* Task Report Macro
* Installer
* Welcome message on the dashboard

h3. Cause
The mismatch occurs when the user's language is different from the global language. In some places, the global language is preferred over the user's. 

h3. Workaround
If it is feasible, ensure that the global language (Confluence Admin > Languages) is set to the same language as the end user's. The end user should also ensure that their browser language is set to their preferred language.
fields.summary: Some strings are not translated in all languages

fields.description:
h3. Context of issue
In Confluence, users can create pages from readily available templates such as Blank page, Blog post, Decision, DACI decision, etc:
* [Create a Page from a Template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-a-page-from-a-template-296093793.html]

When created for the first time, some of them *will also generate* a creation of an Index page, as per mentioned in the documentation: [Blueprints|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blueprints-323982376.html]

{quote}
The first time a blueprint template is used in a space, Confluence creates an index page and adds a shortcut to your sidebar. The index displays a list of pages made with the template, and selected information from your template pages.
{quote}

The index page will contains a [Page Property Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-properties-report-macro-186089616.html] with a predefined settings such as the "Title column heading"  and "Columns to show"

h3. The issue
When a user that has a non-English language set in their profile, creates a new page from a blueprint template, Confluence will generate two pages. One is the actual page created, and the other is the index page.

While the actual page created will contain *translated* column headers, the index page contains untranslated column header (column header appear to be in English).

Since there is a mismatch, the index page will not pull and show all information that it should be.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Confluence, change the language preference to German by going to Profile > Settings > Edit > Change language
# Create a Personal space
# On the personal page, create a new Decision page by going to Create/Erstellen > Entscheidung > Name this page "Decision Page 1"
#* 2 pages are created: "Entscheidungsprotokoll"  and "Decision Page 1"
# Go to the index page, "Entscheidungsprotokoll"

h3. Expected Results
This page will contain translated column header

h3. Actual Results
This page contains untranslated column header

This causes the page to not capture the information that should be extracted from the Decision page "Decision Page 1"
 !DecisionPage1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Entscheidungsprotokoll.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Change the column to show manually:
# Edit the Index page 
# Edit the Page Properties Report Macro
# Expand Option
# On Column to show, change the columns accordingly
#* For example, the following for German: Status,Beteiligte,Ergebnis,Fälligkeitsdatum,Besitzer
fields.summary: Index Blueprint contains untranslated Column headers its Page properties report Macro

fields.description: The spec for the Accept-Language header says we have a 2-3 char language string e.g. "en", optionally followed by a dash and a variant "-US", optionally followed by a quality value (weight) ";q=0.9". It just so happens to be that most if not all browsers send the highest weighted one first and then the rest in reducing order, but they don't have to do that. So a browser could in theory send "en;q=0.3,de-CH;q=0.9" and we would take it to mean they prefer English, but the spec says they prefer Swiss German 🙁
fields.summary: Confluence language detection ignores weights in accept-language header

The notification email sent to a user when a page is edited, is not translated properly to Czech.

In English, it says, <user>edited this page.
 !english.PNG|thumbnail! 

h4. Current Behavior 
In Czech, it says <user> upravilo tuto stránku
 !czech.PNG|thumbnail! 

h4. Expected Behavior
When verb is being translated, one should pay respect to gender of the subject. 
In this case the correct form is "upravil" if the author is male, or "upravila" for female. 
"upravilo" is refering to "it". 
The save way around it is using the form "upravil(a)".

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [Choosing a Default Language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/choosing-a-default-language-214860191.html], you can append {{?i18ntranslate=on}} to the end of your Confluence URL in order to enable user interface key names for translation. To disable it, you are supposed to be able to change it to {{?i18ntranslate=off}} and it will remove the key names.

h3. Environment
Confluence Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Confluence Server instance, log in.
# Change URL to {{https://confluence.server?i18ntranslate=on}}
# Notice the key names have been added: !Screen Shot 2017-10-27 at 4.18.19 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Now, change URL back to {{https://confluence.server?i18ntranslate=off}}
# Key names should be removed

h3. Expected Results
Key names should be removed after {{?i18ntranslate=off}} is appended.

h3. Actual Results
They are not always being removed. In fact, I am not able to remove them at all from my instance.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Unable to disable user interface key names for translation
